com.st.BlueSTSDK

Class Feature

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.BlueSTSDK.Feature
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeviceTimestampFeature, FeatureAcceleration, FeatureAccelerationEvent, FeatureActivity, FeatureAudioADPCM, FeatureAudioADPCMSync, FeatureAutoConfigurable, FeatureBattery, FeatureCarryPosition, FeatureDirectionOfArrival, FeatureFreeFall, FeatureGenPurpose, FeatureGyroscope, FeatureHumidity, FeatureLuminosity, FeatureMagnetometer, FeatureMemsGesture, FeatureMicLevel, FeaturePedometer, FeaturePressure, FeatureProximity, FeatureProximityGesture, FeatureSwitch, FeatureTemperature

    public abstract class Feature
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the data and the description of the data exported by the node

    When you have a new sensor in the node you have to extend this class and implement the method extractData(long, byte[], int) that will extract the information from the raw data arrived from the node. This class will manage the notification and listener subscrition.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    STMicroelectronics - Central Labs.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  Feature.ExtractResult
      class used for return the data and the number of bytes read
      static interface  Feature.FeatureListener
      Interface used for notify that the feature updates its data
      static interface  Feature.FeatureLoggerListener
      This class permit to dump the feature data, both in raw format (the same that that we receive from the node) and after that we parse it
      static class  Feature.Sample
      Class that contains the last data from the node

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Field[] mDataDesc
      array of feature field that describe the feature data with the name, unit and min/max value for each feature field

      list of listener for the feature change.
      protected Feature.Sample mLastSample
      last data received from the node
      protected java.util.Date mLastUpdate
      local time of the last update, automatically update from the default update method
      protected Node mParent
      node that will update this feature
      protected java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock.WriteLock mWriteLock
      lock to acquire before change the data
      protected static java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService sThreadPool
      pool of thread used for notify to the listeners that the feature have new data

      • sThreadPool

        protected static final java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService sThreadPool

      • mFeatureListener

        protected final java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<Feature.FeatureListener> mFeatureListener
        list of listener for the feature change.

        is a thread safe list, so a listener can subscribe itself from a callback

        Feature.FeatureListener

        public boolean isEnabled()
        true if the node export the data of this feature

        a Node can export a feature in the advertise without having the equivalent characteristics

        Returns:

      • getFieldsDesc

        @NonNull
public Field[] getFieldsDesc()
        Get the description of the data field of this feature.

        From the returned data you can know the name and units of the corrispondig data in the array returned by the getFieldData

        Returns:
        data description of the feature

      • getSample

        @Nullable
public Feature.Sample getSample()
        return the last timestamp and the data received from the device
        Returns:
        last data received from the feature or null

      • notifyUpdate

        protected void notifyUpdate(Feature.Sample sample)
        call the method Feature.FeatureListener.onUpdate(Feature, Feature.Sample) for each listener that subscribe to this feature.

        each call will be run in a different thread

        If you extend the method overwrite the method update_priv(long, byte[], int) you have to call this method for notify to the user the new sample

        Parameters:
        sample - new data that we have to notify to the listener

      • logFeatureUpdate

        protected void logFeatureUpdate(byte[] rawData,
                                Feature.Sample sample)
        notify to all the logger that we parse new package

        each logFeatureUpdate(byte[], Sample) will run in a different thread

        if you overwrite the method update_priv(long, byte[], int) you have to call this method after that you update the data, if you want that your feature can be logged

        Parameters:
        rawData - raw data that we have used for extract the feature field, can be null
        sample - sample that we have to log

      • update_priv

        protected int update_priv(long timeStamp,
                          byte[] data,
                          int dataOffset)
        update the feature internal data and notify the update to the listener

        if you overwrite this method, remember to update the the timestamp, the lastUpdate value and to acquire the write lock, when you finish you should to call the notifyUpdate(Sample) and logFeatureUpdate(byte[], Sample) for notify the update to the user

        This method will be called by a package protected method called by the node, in this way we can permit only to the node to call the update method, without export this functionality to the final user

        Parameters:
        timeStamp - package timestamp
        data - array of data where we will extract the data
        dataOffset - data offset fo the data array where we have to read
        Returns:
        number of read byte

      • parseCommandResponse

        protected void parseCommandResponse(int timeStamp,
                                    byte commandType,
                                    byte[] data)
        parse the command response data
        Parameters:
        timeStamp - device time stamp of when the response was send
        commandType - id of the request that the feature did
        data - data attached to the response

        it is implemented as an empty method, it is an optional abstract method

      • extractData

        protected abstract Feature.ExtractResult extractData(long timestamp,
                                                     byte[] data,
                                                     int dataOffset)
        extract the Feature data from a raw byte stream

        You have to parse the data inside the data field skipping the first dataOffset byte.

        This method have to exact the data create a .Sample and return a Extract result containing it

        The method that call this one will manage the lock acquisition/release and to notify to the user the new sample

        Parameters:
        timestamp - data timestamp
        data - array where read the data
        dataOffset - offset where start to read the data
        Returns:
        number of read byte and data extracted

      • writeData

        protected boolean writeData(@NonNull
                            byte[] data)
        in case the corrispondig characteristics has the write permission you can send some data to the feature
        Parameters:
        data - raw data to write
        Returns:
        true if the write command is send correctly, false otherwise

      • sendCommand

        protected boolean sendCommand(byte commandType,
                              @NonNull
                              byte[] data)
        this method can be used for send data to the command characteristic,
        Parameters:
        commandType - integer that identify the command to execute
        data - array of data to send as command parameters, can be an empty array
        Returns:
        true if the node has the command characteristic

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        print the last data received by this feature
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string with the feature data
